title: Augusta County: Clinton Hatcher to Mary Anna Sibert, May 29, 1861
summary: Clinton Hatcher informs Mary Sibert that his parents finally consented to his joining the army and responds to her arguments against his decision. He expresses his desire to protect Virginia from invasion and his approbation of secession. Responding to her inquiries, Hatcher comments on politics and mutual acquaintances.
keywords: Enlistment, Family, Home Front, National Government, Patriotism, Slavery, Women, American Civil War
